questionsAndAnswers.question: Is a llama kosher?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: Why do you ask? Are you planning to eat Madame Llama? Because if so, we have bigger theological problems than dietary laws.

questionsAndAnswers.question: Is Sansa just a dog?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: No. She's the unofficial CEO, spiritual muse, and occasional nap consultant.

questionsAndAnswers.question: What does Rotterdam have to do with Boston?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: About 5,000 lines of code, shared Google Docs, and some videos of Sansa ignoring us.

questionsAndAnswers.question: Did a stuffed animal actually come up with this idea?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: Yes. Madame Llama whispered, “Start the Sansa Foundation.” We listened. You should too — she’s terrifyingly wise.

questionsAndAnswers.question: Are there really six languages?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: Yes. One for each way Miriam and Rene understand the world: through myths, mysticism, eyeliner, hobbits, unresolved childhood emotions — and the one they use to talk to 'normal' people.

questionsAndAnswers.question: Why do you take stories so seriously?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: Because stories built the world. Also because we’re Jewish and arguing with stories is our cardio.

questionsAndAnswers.question: Can I donate Sephora points to the cause?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: Emotionally? Yes. Logistically? We haven’t figured out the halachic ruling on that yet.

questionsAndAnswers.question: Will this project make me cry?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: Probably. But like, in a good, cathartic, “I just remembered who I am” kind of way. And we have tissues.

questionsAndAnswers.question: Is there a plan, or are you winging this?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: Yes.

questionsAndAnswers.question: Does Madame Llama have voting rights?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: She has veto power. Which is worse.

questionsAndAnswers.question: What’s the official halacha on digital folk tales?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: Somewhere between Pirkei Avot and fan art. We’re still investigating.

questionsAndAnswers.question: Why does this feel like a fever dream and a thesis defense at once?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: Because it is. And also because you're paying attention.

questionsAndAnswers.question: Will this help me understand my family?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: No. But it might help you forgive them. Or at least re-cast them.

questionsAndAnswers.question: What if I don’t understand any of the languages?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: That’s okay. Sometimes the language understands you first.

questionsAndAnswers.question: What does Sansa think of all this?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: She's still waiting for royalties. But she approves of the poetic license.

questionsAndAnswers.question: Are hobbits canon here?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: Yes. Especially the ones who read footnotes.

questionsAndAnswers.question: Is this a cult?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: No, but we do have a shared Google Calendar and a lot of candlelight.

questionsAndAnswers.question: Are you okay?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: Define “okay.”

questionsAndAnswers.question: Will Rene always be this intense?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: Only on days that end in “y.” But don’t worry, he comes with snacks and edits.

questionsAndAnswers.question: What happens when Rene goes quiet?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: It usually means he’s writing something dangerous. Or figuring out the perfect song lyric to say what he can’t.

questionsAndAnswers.question: Does Rene ever stop thinking in metaphors?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: No. It’s how Rene finds shape in things that would otherwise stay silent.

questionsAndAnswers.question: What exactly did Madame Llama say to Rene?
questionsAndAnswers.answer: “Your name is carved into this story. So go make it worth reading.”

initialDialog.title: Welcome to The Lorderian Realm
initialDialog.paragraph: Experience the ephemeral nature of knowledge:

validationDialog.title: Are you ready to embrace the deeper currents?
